dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SPOTLIGHT slices black space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In its beam, a DANCER materializes. She is fair-skinned. Beautiful and pure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The maiden twirls on pointe, a smile on her face, light a air and carefree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses, her face grows worried. Sensing someone watch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scared, she peers into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves now, looking, growing more frantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, a SINISTER MAN emerges out of the darkness behind h She stumbles backwards, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to escape, twirling away, but he pursues. His t form is revealed, the demon ROTHBART.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flings his open hand towards her, casting the spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wants to scream, but nothing comes out. She looks at body, sensing something happening to her. Something terrifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spins, panicking, but it's too late. She disappears beneath the beast's cape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She emerges as the WHITE SWAN, the iconic protagonist of LAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the darkness, a pair of EYES. They belong to NINA, the same dancer. She lies awake in bed, thinking about her dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room looks like it hasn't been redecorated since she a teenager. Stuffed animals. Dolls. Pink and frilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens, throwing LIGHT on her face. Nina looks towards the door and smiles softly at whoever opened it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina sits up and hangs her BARE FEET off the side of the Like all ballerinas, she's beautiful and her feet are atrocious. Covered in corns, broken blisters and bunions. arches them, doing her first extensions of the day. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is empty of furniture to leave space for dancing large mirror covers the opposite wall entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina rubs her knees to get them warm, and then begins her morning exercises, extending and contracting her feet and legs in precise and rhythmic motions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skin on her chest stretches tautly over her sternum. Defined vertebrae run up her back, sinewy muscles contrac she moves. Her slender neck leads into her hair, containe in a ballerina's bun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina looks serene as she moves, completely in her element

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears someone fussing about in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had the most amazing dream last night. I was dancing the White Swan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different choreography, like the Bolshoi's. It was the prologue, when Rothbart casts his spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina continues to stretch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina sits at the table. An older woman, ERICA, places a POACHED EGG and a QUARTER-GRAPEFRUIT in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in a good mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just excited to get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off-season always makes you grumpy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look how pink. So pretty. 2A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inside joke) (inside joke) Pretty. Pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They giggle and Erica resumes packing Nina's shoulder bag with extra clothing, shoes, snack filled tupperware, duct tape, ribbon, thread, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus he promised to feature me more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He certainly should. You're the most dedicated dancer in the company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina smiles, comforted, and begins taking her vitamins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica walks over with a SWEATSHIRT and holds it above her Nina pulls it over her head and starts to push her arms through the sleeves. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica points to her shoulder. Nina feels and finds a smal SCRATCH MARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrugs and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica gives her a suspicious look, but lets it go and smi Nina finishes pulling down the sweatshirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica hugs Nina into her chest and kisses the top of her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica releases her and Nina begins eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina rides inside a crowded subway, staring absentmindedl her faint reflection in the train's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, another train roars by on the opposite track, snapping her awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the next train car, she sees the back of a BALLERINA standing in the midst of the crowd. Her head bops to musi playing through iPod earphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina moves a strand of hair out of her eyes, and at that exact moment, the girl in the next car moves in the same Mirroring her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unnerved, Nina slowly lowers her arm. So does the other g Although Nina can't quite see her face, the girl seems IDENTICAL from Nina's vantage point. 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train jerks to a stop as it arrives at a station. Nin sees the girl head to the exit. She cranes to see her fac but her view's obscured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors slide shut and the train pulls out. Nina watche the platform whisk by, keeping her eyes peeled, but she doesn't see the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina emerges from the subway station onto a city street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She arrives at the MAJESTIC-LOOKING THEATER, where a few other BALLERINAS likewise trickle towards the entrance. T all look strangely similar: slender, carrying shoulder ba wearing leggings and loose sweatshirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passes a ROW OF POSTERS featuring the company's prima ballerina, BETH MACINTYRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina looks at them, a little envious, before continuing o the STAGE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crammed into a single dressing room, Nina and the company SOLOISTS get ready for rehearsal. Chatting, sewing ribbon onto shoes, applying makeup, putting band-aids on blister

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina removes a new pair of BALLET SHOES, admires them for moment, before cutting off the satin toe with scissors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, catty VERONICA and Russian GALINA goss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't believe she's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't take a hint? Company's broke. No one comes to see her anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one comes to see ballet period. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true, I heard the Royal had one of their best seasons yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs to try something new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, someone new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like someone who's not approaching menopause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They snicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's sad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth's such an amazing dancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So's my grand-mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fonteyn danced into her 50's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irked, Nina starts POUNDING the shoes against the floor t soften the toe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes are drawn to a NEW GIRL standing in the doorway. Nina pauses to scrutinize her. She wears vampy make-up, h down. Dark and sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soloists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wary, the girls mumble mmm-hmm's and nod.

dialogues.speaker: NEW GIRL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Great. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slinks past the suspicious group of girls and plops d at an open spot.

dialogues.speaker: NEW GIRL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fucking got off the wrong stop and had to hoof it from 79th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina exchanges glances with the other girls, taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new girl notices the looks, smirks to herself and sta getting ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina wears a look of intense concentration as the entire company warms up, including the pubescent CORPS MEMBERS a handful of MALE DANCERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEGS, HANDS, and FEET repeat the same movements all aroun her, led by a severe BALLET MISTRESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the back, fondu, to the back, plie. Fourth, fourth, and one and fifth, to the back... (to a corps member) Like this. Push it. Why can't you do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using the mirror, Nina monitors her movements carefully. mistress surprises her.

dialogues.speaker: BALLET MISTRESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It needs to be looser. Relax. Let it flow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flustered, Nina nods and tries to follow her instruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the girls around Nina begin stripping off their sweatshirts and insulated pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina sees that the intense and brooding director of the company, THOMAS LEROY, has entered the space. He has the unkept look of an artist. Magnetic and intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ballerinas remove their warm-up gear to show off thei bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy walks around the room, judging his flock. Smiles an glances are thrown his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes up to the ballet mistress, takes her hand and kis her on the cheek. Even she manages a smile. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads to the line of soloists, studying them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all know the story: virginal girl, pure and sweet, trapped in the body of a swan. She desires freedom, but only true love can break the spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taps a dancer on the shoulder, she lights up. He walks then taps another. A selection process of some kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina looks nervous, has an inkling of what it means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her wish is granted in the form of a prince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nears Nina. She sneaks peeks at him, eager and hopeful He acknowledges her with a small nod and a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he walks on without tapping her. She deflates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before he can declare his love, her lustful twin, the Black Swan, tricks and seduces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches the New Girl. Nina watches, threatened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he doesn't tap her either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devastated, the White Swan leaps off a cliff, killing herself. But, in death, finds freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taps one more soloist and then CLAPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music stops and all the girls face him, attentive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They respond "Good morning" in nervous, unsure voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We open our season with Swan Lake. Done to death, I know. But not like this. We strip it down. Make it visceral and real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses for effect. 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a new production needs a new Swan Queen. A fresh face to present to the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised, the soloists glance at each other, trying to k their cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But which of you can embody both swans? The white and the black?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina prepares for disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the soloists I touched... Please go to your scheduled rehearsals this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the girls I didn't touch, meet me in studio B at five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina breathes, realizing the girls he didn't tap are the he's selected, purposefully toying with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hidden inside a nook, Nina has her eyes closed, nervously HUMMING the score to Swan Lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes small motions with her feet and hands, going through the choreography in her mind. Preparing for the audition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A loud CRASHING sound snaps her out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes out into the hallway to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to a PRINCIPAL DRESSING ROOM is halfway open. Ni cautiously approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, she can see someone moving around the room in a f trashing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the door swings open and BETH MACINTYRE bursts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes brief eye-contact with Nina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina just shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth scoffs as she slams the door behind her. She clips d the hall in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina waits until she's gone, then moves closer to the doo and peeks inside, curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She checks to make sure no one's around and quickly enter

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large and comfortable. Beth's presence is everywhere. Photographs, clothing, and personal belongings scattered across the space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina looks at herself in the mirror and smiles, imagining great it would be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she notices a LARGE VASE lying on the floor. The flo have been shredded, water everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves to the vanity counter and touches Beth's belongings in reverence. The items are neatly laid out: ballet supplies, jewelry, and makeup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her fingers brush a tube of LIPSTICK. She picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina slips the lipstick into her bag and exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of her audition, Nina dances Odette's Varia from Act II of the ballet, a frightened look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although her movement is incredibly precise, there's a definite vulnerability. Exactly as the White Swan should fear tinged with melancholy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy waves his arm. The music and Nina stop abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches her and, when he gets close, taps on her sternum with two of his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Nina, would you like to be the Swan Queen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want me to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans in and talks softly so the other girls can't hea 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if I was just casting the White Swan, she'd be yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't help but smile, flattered. He pulls away from h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to the PIANO PLAYER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maestro, Odile's Coda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The piano player rifles through the song book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me your Black Swan, Nina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervous, she glances over at Veronica and Galina, who anxiously await their turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a few breaths, then looks towards the piano pla and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina dances a few steps, and then launches into the most difficult and famous part of Swan Lake: The Black Swan's Coda. It consists of 32 consecutive fouettes (spins).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, not so controlled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music builds in intensity, she pushes herself into th next turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seduce us! Not just the Prince, but the court, the audience, the entire world! The fouettes are like a spider spinning her web. Come on! Attack it! Attack it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy runs his hand through his hair, dismayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of worry spreads across Nina's face. Knows she's blowing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door CLANGS open and throws Nina's focus completely. stumbles, several spins short of finishing. 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The New Girl obliviously marches into the room, listening an iPod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good of you to join us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The New Girl notices everyone staring and pulls out her earphones to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls, this is Lily. Straight off the plane from San Francisco. She's filling Rebecca's old spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LILY gives a small wave. Nina eyes her with scorn as she catches her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, get warmed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily starts stripping off her layers, revealing her lithe body. On her back, she has a TATTOO OF LILIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I go again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted by Lily) I've seen enough. Thank you, Nina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down, getting his meaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Veronica. Your turn. The White Swan's variation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, Nina marches out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina stands up from a kneeled position and flushes the toilet. She wipes her mouth with the back of her hand and exits the stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina walks along a quiet side street. She clutches her jacket, for warmth and comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her CELL PHONE starts ringing. She digs it out of her bag checks the CALLER ID: MOM. She silences it and puts it aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up ahead, she sees the sidewalk dead end at a constructio site, and detour into an enclosed PASSAGEWAY beneath the scaffolding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina slows, a little scared, but decides to push on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passageway is dark. The temporary lighting dim and flickering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks quickly, trying to get to the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears the sound of soft FOOTSTEPS approaching. She stops, and the other FOOTSTEPS stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up and sees the faint outline of a SLENDER WOMA standing there, almost ghostlike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina starts walking again, keeping her head down, and the other woman continues as well. 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they pass each other, Nina glances at the woman's face discovers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman looks EXACTLY LIKE HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the moment passes as the woman continues walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina stares after her, perturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her cell phone starts RINGING again, piercing the silence Nina continues out, ignoring the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina enters and locks the deadbolt and chain-lock behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and is startled to see Erica standing right the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina looks at her confused. Erica helps take off her coat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were late, so I called Susie in the office. An audition?! Can't believe he just sprung that on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It went okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica hangs up her coat, turns and sees Nina tearing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tears start falling now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica goes to her and wraps her in an embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh, shhh, tell me what happened. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina lies on the floor, stewing. Her legs straight in the to drain the lactic acid in her muscles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them it doesn't matter how talented their daughter is, if she misses any more classes, she's out. She forgets half of what I teach her, and I waste time catching her up. It's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina sits up and retrieves a pair of point shoes from her bag. She considers them for a moment, then starts to put on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands, takes a breath, and does a single spin, testi the waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a breath and spins again, then again, then agai Each spin is punctuated by a jab of her foot into the flo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She jabs her toe down, hard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She winces in pain and automatically grabs her foot.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Everything alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina leans her back against the mirror and removes her sh Her right big toenail has split, oozing blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina breathes through the pain and puts her shoe back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reassumes the position, takes a couple breaths, and starts spinning again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her toe jabs into the floor. She winces a little with pai but keeps pushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face grows more determined, focused. 20, 21, 22 spins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to look powerful, willing herself to succeed. 14A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the 32nd spin, Nina jabs her foot down hard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's done it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina looks at herself in the mirror, glazed in sweat, a slight smile of satisfaction. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina sits on the edge of the bed, as Erica douses some GA with PEROXIDE and dabs it on the split toenail. Nina reac to the sting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh. Almost done...You're working yourself too hard. We all have off days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that girl hadn't barged in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure she didn't mean to. Remember when you started? If I hadn't taken you to each of your classes, you would have been completely lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna talk to him. Tell him I finished it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows you can do the coda. It won't convince him one way or the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annoyed, Nina lies down, looking away from her mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sweetheart, I know it's  disappointing. When you start to  get older, there's all this  ridiculous pressure. God knows, I  understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica squeezes some arnica gel into her palm and massages into Nina's calves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's alright. No matter what.  You'll probably get to dance the Pas de Quatre again. That's such a wonderful part. Or maybe he'll make you a Big Swan. Either way, you'll shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, mom. 15A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica removes Nina's EARRINGS, then opens a JEWELRY BOX sitting on the night stand and drops them inside. A TOY BALLERINA spins to TINNY MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina gets under the covers. Erica tucks her in and sits d on the edge of the bed. 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything will be better in the morning. It always is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She strokes Nina's hair, humming along to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina watches the ballerina spin and spin with a determine stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina applies the lipstick she stole from Beth, using the window as a mirror. The jerky motion of the train makes i difficult, but she manages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina waits anxiously outside Leroy's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears someone approach, looks up and sees Leroy comin down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts on a nervous smile. He doesn't reciprocate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Nina?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't answer, just opens the door to the office and walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a breath and then follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina closes the door and faces the cozy, dark space. Larg couch, posters from the ballet on the wall--several featu Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy lights a cigarette, quietly studying her and not ma this easy. He takes a drag, and exhales. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If now's not a good time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now's fine, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to tell you, I practiced the coda last night, and I did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How thrilling for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Nina, listen, I honestly don't care about your technique, you should know that by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I've already chosen Veronica, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts his hands in the air, "there you go."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes a move towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to try and change my mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back at him, uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy nonchalantly stubs out his cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have thought it was possible, coming to find me like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses, looks her up and down as if trying to decipher her. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here? All dolled up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to ask you to give me the part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't know what he means. He comes around his desk approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth is, when I look at you, all I see is the White Swan. Yes, you're beautiful, fragile, fearful. Ideal casting. But the Black Swan...it's a hard fucking job to dance both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can be the Black Swan too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? She's hungry, volatile. In four years, every time you dance, I see you obsess over getting each move exactly right, but I never see you lose yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insecure, she looks like she wants to run out of the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that discipline, for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfection's not just about control. It's also about letting go. Surprising the audience. Surprising yourself. Transcendence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He considers her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very few have it in them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning, he slowly plants a kiss on her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It lasts for a moment, but he suddenly jerks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He touches his lip, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bit me. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's too scared to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it. That fucking hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the mirror to check for damage. He glances bac Nina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quickly leaves, shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The company stretch and go through their usual warm-up routine, a tension in the air. The casting decision still uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina touches her lips, thinking about the encounter. Then looks over at Veronica, knowing the good news in store. Veronica notices. Nina looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sudden energy sweeps the room, and she hears the sound scuffling feet and whispering. "It's up." "She just poste it." "C'mon."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dancers start exiting into the hallway. Veronica turn follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veronica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veronica turns around. It's hard, but Nina decides to be good loser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina subtly glances at the exiting girls and Veronica immediately gets it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She excitedly pushes through the crowd of girls, wanting see for herself. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knowing the outcome already, Nina continues stretching in deserted space, resigned to her fate. She finishes, grabs her belongings and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd of dancers surround the bulletin board, jostling get a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina starts walking down the hall in the opposite directi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind her, she can hear a small commotion and then:

dialogues.speaker: VERONICA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Why did you tell me that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and sees Veronica, her face flushed with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your idea of a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veronica storms away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group of girls stares at Nina, making her very self- conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina tentatively approaches the bulletin board, to see wh Veronica's outburst was all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First a few, then more and more of the girls smile at her They make room for her as she pushes through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finally gets to the CASTING NOTICE, finds "Swan Queen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned, she turns around to face the mass of ballerinas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Lily eyeing her with a flat expression, which tu into a smile to mask her disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other girls start congratulating and hugging Nina, so more sincerely than others. 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina bursts in through the door and heads directly for on the stalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She locks herself in for privacy and dials a number on he CELL PHONE. She holds it to her ear, anxiously waiting fo the person to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...Everything's fine...He picked me, mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waits for a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear me?...Yes, I'm going to be the Swan Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina laughs at her mother's response and can't help but s crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be home soon, okay? I just had to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina hangs up and the tears really start flowing. She's dreamt of this for so long, it's almost too much to bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wipes the tears off with the back of her hand and pul herself together. She comes out of the stall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrified to discover "WHORE" written on the mirror in RE LIPSTICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina looks around the bathroom, to make sure she's alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snags a paper towel and wipes off the insult, smearin the mirror with red streaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina unlocks the door to the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina looks around, puzzled she isn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina opens the door and pokes her head in. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Erica's not in there either. Nina glances at the wall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where several homemade PAINTINGS hang, all of the same subject: Nina as a young girl, posing in a tutu. On a des the ORIGINAL PHOTOGRAPH is clipped to a painting in progr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the corner of her eye, one of the portraits seems shift. Nina turns towards it, but the painting's now perfectly still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unsettled, Nina withdraws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Post-shower, Nina's fuzzy reflection stares back in a ste covered mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina takes her hand and wipes a streak across, to see her more clearly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks nervous. The enormity of what's in front of her setting in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns side-to-side, scrutinizing her body. She lifts arm and pinches the skin to check her weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices a small cluster of RED BUMPS on her shoulder. small RASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She feels the bumps with her fingers, bothered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She checks the same place on her other shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no rash, just faint streaks of SCAR TISSUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina slides the hamper in front of the door to block it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the mirror now, one of the bumps is scratched and bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina quickly wipes the blood off with her finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the front door opening steals her attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina exits the bathroom wearing a robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the kitchen, she sees a CAKE with a lit SPARKLER sitti on the table. Her mother smiles anxiously. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter, the Swan Queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens her arms and Nina falls into a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the cake. It has a ballerina sketched with frosting. Nina hides her disdain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our favorite, vanilla with strawberry filling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica picks up a knife and slices into the cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica ignores her and starts cutting a very large piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's way too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a celebration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My stomach's still in knots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica grabs the whole cake and heads towards the trash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, don't. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica hesitates, but returns. She sets the cake back down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just so proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica lifts the slice onto a plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks yummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First day in the new role, Nina stretches alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muffled sounds of other ballerinas chatting and giggling drift in from the large rehearsal space. Makes Nina feel little isolated.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina turns and sees DAVID, the high-cheeked, cocky dancer playing Prince Siegfried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is so full, where do I stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is his version of a joke. Nina politely laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...good luck finding a spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you are. I'm Nina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Here we go, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David dances around the space, miming a hunt with a cross bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina enters, stretches her body to illustrate her transformation into human, then sees David and acts spook 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She dances away from him, a scared look on her face, undulating her arms to resemble a bird's flapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David gives chase, but Nina spins out of his grasp, disentangles from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he eventually snags her, and they come very close together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music stops. Nina breaks out of character and looks a Leroy, anxious for his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Russian ballet mistress nods and smiles, clearly plea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Nina. Very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina smiles, relieved. Leroy hops out of his chair and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I knew the White Swan wouldn't be a problem. The real work will be your metamorphosis into the Black Swan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw a flash of her yesterday. Get ready to show me more of that bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her an impish smirk. She looks down, embarrassed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina takes a drink from the water fountain. She hears mus emanating from the large rehearsal studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious, she walks to the open doorway and stops to watch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORPS MEMBERS and a few soloists form two lines on both s of the room. In the middle, Veronica dances along with Li

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina pays close attention to Lily, sizing her up. Her dan is explosive, exudes sex.

dialogues.speaker: LEROY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Watch the way she moves... 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy has snuck up behind Nina at the doorway and gets ve close to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imprecise, but sensual. She's not faking it. Pay attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily makes a small mistake, but cracks up laughing, amuse rather than bothered by her blunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina stares at her, attracted and threatened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The company's administrator, SUSIE, shows Nina into the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You share with Beth from now on, so be considerate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Susie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awed, Nina looks around the room. She scans Beth's photographs and personal belongings, and lands on a large bouquet of FRESH FLOWERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are for you. From Mr. Leroy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina pulls a card out from the flowers and reads. A faint smile curls her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens her shoulder bag and removes a SMALL SATCHEL. S pulls out a pair of DIAMOND STUD EARRINGS and puts them o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy pulls Nina through a fundraiser gala, filled with r looking PATRONS and some DANCERS from the company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bewildered, Nina takes in her high-society surroundings, getting the occasional curious glance as she passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy grabs a couple CHAMPAGNE glasses off a WAITER'S tra He hands a glass to Nina with a smile. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads her up a staircase to a landing that overlooks t party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to be thrown to the wolves? We need their cash, so smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, as instructed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, good evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd turns their gaze towards them. All eyes on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I stand here tonight, I see so many familiar faces. Your  contribution to the art we all cherish profoundly goes straight to my heart and I am very grateful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polite applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me begin with a very important announcement. You all have had the chance to be enchanted, transported, sometimes devastated by the performances of this true artist of our company. She has been an exceptional inspiration to my work, a role model to our dancers and a deeply satisfying presence on our stage. You all know who I am talking about...Beth Macintyre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More applause. Nervous, Nina unconsciously picks at her cuticles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we all know, every great career comes to an end. Beth is retiring at the end of the season. She will be giving her farewell performance as Melpomene, the role she originated in my first ballet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People start whispering, stunned by the news. Nina sees B in the crowd, giving a sad smile to the surrounding guest Trying to remain dignified. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She will be greatly missed, but she will always be remembered. My little princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst the mummering, Nina sees Beth quietly sneak out of crowd and out the front door. Leroy quickly covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as we bid adieu to one star, we welcome another!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Nina. She stops picking her nails, self- conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you know, we open our season with my new version of Swan Lake. Taking the role of our new Swan Queen is the exquisite Ms. Nina Sayers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Restrained APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina steps forward and curtseys. Someone seems to GIGGLE her. Insecure, Nina glances towards the source and sees L flirting with a RICH GENT, uninterested in the official proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon you will have the pleasure of seeing her perform, tonight we raise a glass. To all of you, to Nina, to Beth, to beauty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He downs his drink and the crowd follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARTY GUESTS surround Nina and Leroy, trying to meet the company's newest star. Nina basks in all the attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Brinson and his lovely wife, Ellen, tonight's sponsors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes DR. BRINSON'S hand and curtseys to MRS. BRINSO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a beautiful event. 29.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRINSON
dialogues.text: Not as beautiful as you, dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina demurs. They're replaced by another HUSBAND and WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this is Mr. and Mrs. Stein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina repeats the pleasantries, this time noticing that on her cuticles is bleeding. She awkwardly pulls her hand aw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy leans in and whispers in her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, you're doing great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina washes her hands. She looks at herself in the mirror takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone KNOCKS on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns off the water and wipes her damp hands on the b of her neck, trying to cool herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She checks her finger. No blood, but there's a HANGNAIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina takes hold of the small flap and tries to yank it of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accidentally tearing a strip of skin from the nail to her second knuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More KNOCKING startles her.

dialogues.speaker: LILY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Come on! I'm about to burst!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina quickly balls up the peeled skin and throws it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily pushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Look who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily closes the door behind her and locks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Lily, by the way. Don't think we've officially met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our New Swan Queen! That is so huge! You must be freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily slides her PANTIES out from under her dress and puts them in her clutch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should probably get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay. Keep me company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily starts to refresh her makeup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina stays put for a second, uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door and steps out, where she's immediately by Leroy.

dialogues.speaker: LEROY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Ah, there you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily closes the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leroy escorts Nina out. It's a couple hours later and she tipsy. She stumbles a little and grabs onto Leroy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I drank too much. All those toasts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tried to eat you alive, but here you are, in one piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you a cab. Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Upper West Side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you come to my place first? It's on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a coy glance, reading between the lines and hiding her excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a drink. Unless you've had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to look for a cab. 32.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRINSON, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Thomas!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn, see Mrs. Brinson, the host of the party, stand at the door.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. BRINSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You need to say hello to Karen Halloway before you disappear. She's from Texas. Correction: she is Texas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A minute more of ass-kissing. Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs back inside to say his goodbyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina smiles after him, giddy and anxious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices a slender figure watching her from the shadow the adjoining doorway. In the dark, she looks like Nina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spotted, the figure backs up, seeming to disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina cautiously approaches, but can't see anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets closer to the doorway...and someone JUMPS OUT, startling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Beth, drunk and shivering. Cheeks streaked with masc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth? What are you doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth stares her down. Nina backs up, nervously grabbing h earlobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was crushed to hear that you're leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do to get the role? 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina shakes her head, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He always said you were a frigid little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her words needle Nina, too close to the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what did you do to make him change his mind? Suck his cock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of us don't need to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nina's struck a nerve. Beth starts to come at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking little whore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, I'm-

dialogues.speaker: LEROY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both turn to see Leroy returned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're drunk. You should go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that! Don't just dismiss me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor, poor little princess. Try to hold it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Blushing and feeling awkward, she takes a sip of champagn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: 72B Nina is worked up, breathing hard. 72B
